intro: Eriogonum gramineum, commonly known as the grassleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces pale to greenish-yellow blooms that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eriogonum gramineum is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ecological benefits.
